synopsis.text:
Our tale unfolds in a sprawling metropolis with seemingly infinite layers, where the sky and the ground blur into one, and direction loses all meaning. In this labyrinthine city, a solitary figure named Kirii embarks on a quest to discover the elusive 'Net Terminal Genes' that remain untainted. Kirii's journey, laden with an enigmatic burden, forms the crux of this intriguing narrative.

The story also introduces Cibo, a character whose tale wasn't fully explored in the original work. Cibo, having wandered off with Kirii, stumbles upon a discarded disc amidst the debris and initiates a download. The question lingers - whose memories will Cibo ultimately acquire?

Based on Tsutomu Nihei's manga, BLAME! presents a somber and abstract narrative. Kirii, a human amidst a sea of clones and androids, is tasked with collecting the 'net-genes'. His mission, shrouded in mystery, is to locate any surviving humans.

This visual spectacle takes us through a city of thousands of levels, where the distinction between up and down is lost. In this vast, multi-level city, Kirii, a man of mystery, seeks the legendary 'Net Terminal Genes' that have remained uncorrupted. But why are these genes so crucial?

In a world where the future has been entombed for 3000 years, and machines endlessly construct a colossal Megastructure, the Silicon Creatures emerge. Their objective: invade the Netsphere and exterminate all organic life. Our sole defense is a salvaged data disc from the engineer Cibo, which could potentially enable humans to restore order to the world.
